name: St. John the Baptist

locations.description: Preached and baptized in the Jordan River

summary: John the Baptist was a Jewish prophet who prepared the way for Jesus Christ. He baptized Jesus in the Jordan River and is considered the last and greatest of the Old Testament prophets. He preached repentance and the coming of the Messiah. He was imprisoned and beheaded by Herod Antipas for condemning Herod's marriage to his brother's wife. Jesus called him the greatest man born of woman.
keyQuotes: Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world.
He must increase, but I must decrease.
